description: Two dragon heads emerge from a cave, looking unimpressed at a tree stump tied to a stake, crudely decorated with a hat, fake nose, and hair to resemble a person. The situation presents a surreal twist on the classic fantasy trope of a damsel tied up for a dragon, highlighting the absurdity of using an inanimate object as bait. The dragons' reaction implies a practical problem with this unconventional substitute. This scene subverts expectations by presenting mythological creatures dealing with mundane issues of procuring appropriate sacrifices or targets. The core irony lies in the powerful dragons being inconvenienced by a poorly executed attempt at deception.
caption: “It’s no use. … We’ve just got to get ourselves a real damsel.”
